questions.question_text: What can the administrator use to identify overlay segments in an NSX environment if troubleshooting is required?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct, as in the official 4.X guide

questions.question_text: How does the Traceflow tool identify issues in a network?

choices.D: Injects synthetic traffic into the data plane and observes the results in the control plane.
choices.A: Compares intended network state in the control plane with Tunnel End Point (TEP) keepalives in the data plane.
choices.C: Injects ICMP traffic into the data plane and observes the results in the control plane.
choices.B: Compares the management plane configuration states containing control plane traffic and error reporting from transport node agents.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Correct, as in the official 4.X guide

Selected Answer: B
Correct, as in the official 4.X guide

discussion.content:

questions.question_text: When a stateful service is enabled for the first time on a Tier-0 Gateway, what happens on the NSX Edge node?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct, as in the official 4.X guide

choices.B: SR is instantiated and automatically connected with DR.
choices.C: SR and DR doesnâ€™t need to be connected to provide any stateful services.
choices.A: DR is instantiated and automatically connected with SR.
choices.D: SR and DR is instantiated but requires manual connection.
